intro: Philadelphus brachybotrys var. laxiflorus, commonly known as the narrow-flowered mock orange, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It features fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and smooth, gray-green bark. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is often used in gardens for its ornamental value.
